Reproducible Data Science Final Project 2023 Chapter 1 Project description 1.1 Datasets available 1.2 Database structure

Reproducible Data Science Final Project 2023 Maria Stahl 2023-03-18 Chapter 1 Project description For my dissertation, I am following a herd of 40 cows in San Juan County, UT. 20 of these individuals are Red Angus, a conventional breed of cattle, and 20 are Raramuri Criollo, a heritage breed of cattle from the mountains of northern Mexico. Previous research suggests that Criollo cows may be better adapted to hot and dry desert conditions, making them a more sustainable alternative to Red Angus that would allow producers to maintain ecosystem function and health under livestock production. 1.1 Datasets available As part of this project, I am linking together many datasets into one relational database. Each cow as been equipped with GPS collars to track movement, and we have periodically collected morphometric data and fecal samples from the herd. Below are the datasets I have available and am adding to the database: * Cow bread and ear tag ID * Beef metrics (including weights and body condition scores) * Diet sample data * Collar deployment dates * Collars (including brand and serial number) * GPS data (raw from the collars) 1.2 Database structure Below is a schematic of the structure of my relational database. The next chapter will detail how the database was constructed. Schematic of database structure

Chapter 2 Combine collar data from Lotek and ATS collars 2.1 Description 2.2 Read Lotek collar data 2.3 Read ATS data 2.4 Combine collar data 2.5 add cow ear tag and breed info 2.6 clean collar data 2.7 save output to .csv

Chapter 2 Combine collar data from Lotek and ATS collars 2.1 Description This code creates a database file called cattle.db and populates it with all my various .csv files. As it is now, this chapter has no narration between code chunks but I intend to go back and fill in some of the details later. 2.2 Read Lotek collar data # gps file names lotek.collar.files.march = list.files(path = "../cattle/raw data/collar data/2022-03_collarData/gps", pattern = "*.csv", full.names = T) lotek.collar.files.june = list.files(path = "../cattle/raw data/collar data/2022-06_collarData/gps", pattern = "*.csv", full.names = T) lotek.collar.files.all = c(lotek.collar.files.march, lotek.collar.files.june) # collar numbers lotek.collar.numbers = lotek.collar.files.all %>% substring(nchar(.)-28, nchar(.)-24) # collar data lotek.collar.list = lotek.collar.files.all %>% map(~fread(.)) # add column with collar number for(i in seq_along(lotek.collar.list)){ lotek.collar.list[[i]]$CollarSerialNumber <- lotek.collar.numbers[i] } cattle.dat.lotek = lotek.collar.list %>% bind_rows() 2.3 Read ATS data # gps file names ats.files = list.files(path = "../cattle/raw data/collar data/ats", pattern = "*.txt", full.names = T) # collar data ats.collar.list = ats.files %>% map(~fread(.)) # create data.frame from list cattle.dat.ATS = ats.collar.list %>% bind_rows() 2.4 Combine collar data # what column names are we working with here? names(cattle.dat.ATS) ## [1] "CollarSerialNumber" "Year" "Julianday" ## [4] "Hour" "Minute" "Activity" ## [7] "Temperature" "Latitude" "Longitude" ## [10] "HDOP" "NumSats" "FixTime" ## [13] "2D/3D" "Date" names(cattle.dat.lotek) ## [1] "GMT Time" "Latitude" "Longitude" ## [4] "Altitude" "Duration" "Temperature" ## [7] "DOP" "Satellites" "Cause of Fix" ## [10] "CollarSerialNumber" ### add date_time column to both data.frames ---- # Lotek cattle.dat.lotek$date_time = as.POSIXct(cattle.dat.lotek$`GMT Time`, format = '%m/%d/%Y %H:%M:%S %p', tz = 'GMT') # ATS cattle.dat.ATS$Date = as.Date(cattle.dat.ATS$Julianday, origin = '2021-12-31') cattle.dat.ATS$date_time = paste(cattle.dat.ATS$Hour, cattle.dat.ATS$Minute, sep = ':') %>% paste(cattle.dat.ATS$Date, .) %>% as.POSIXct(format = '%Y-%m-%d %H:%M') ### rename NumSat column ---- cattle.dat.lotek = cattle.dat.lotek %>% rename(NumSats = Satellites) ### add DOP column to ATS cattle.dat.ATS = cattle.dat.ATS %>% mutate(DOP = NA) ### add HDOP column to Lotek cattle.dat.lotek = cattle.dat.lotek %>% mutate(HDOP = NA) ### drop unneeded columns ---- cattle.dat.ATS = cattle.dat.ATS %>% dplyr::select(c('CollarSerialNumber', 'date_time', 'Latitude', 'Longitude', 'Temperature', 'NumSats', 'DOP', 'HDOP')) cattle.dat.lotek = cattle.dat.lotek %>% dplyr::select(c('CollarSerialNumber', 'date_time', 'Latitude', 'Longitude', 'Temperature', 'NumSats', 'DOP', 'HDOP')) ### create final data.frame ---- cattle.dat = rbind(cattle.dat.ATS, cattle.dat.lotek) %>% mutate(CollarSerialNumber = as.integer(CollarSerialNumber)) 2.5 add cow ear tag and breed info ## read in collar metadata collar.metadata = read.csv('../cattle/raw data/collar_pedometer-metadata/collar data log.csv') %>% mutate(download_start = as.POSIXct(download_start, format = '%m/%d/%Y')) %>% mutate(download_end = as.POSIXct(download_end, format = '%m/%d/%Y')) %>% rename(CollarSerialNumber = collar.no) collar.metadataS22.S23 = collar.metadata %>% filter(download_end > as.POSIXct("2021-11-10 MST")) cattle.dat.tags = left_join(cattle.dat, collar.metadataS22.S23[,1:3]) ## Joining, by = "CollarSerialNumber" 2.6 clean collar data NOTE: for now, Iâ€™m just removing all points with coordinates (0,0). I will need to change this to filter points based on NumSats or DOP/HDOP cattle.dat.tags = cattle.dat.tags %>% filter(Latitude != 0 & Longitude != 0) 2.7 save output to .csv write.csv(cattle.dat.tags, file = '../processed data/2021-2022_GPS-combined.csv', row.names = F)
Chapter 3 Create cattle.db database 3.1 Description 3.2 create cattle.db file 3.3 import metadata .csv files 3.4 add tag_no column to diet data 3.5 create tables in SQL

Chapter 3 Create cattle.db database 3.1 Description This code reads in all the Lotek and ATS GPS .csv files, organizes them into the same format, and combines them into one .csv with the associated cow metadata (ear tag and breed). We need to do this before we create the database! Jan 2023: Lotek GPS files are matched with cattle ID based only on collar ID. This will be an issue in the future when we start re-using Lotek collars and have multiple cattle IDs associated with each Lotek collar. When this happens, I will need to add a section of code that looks not only at the collar ID but also at the dates to match collars to cows. 3.2 create cattle.db file cattle_db = dbConnect(RSQLite::SQLite(), '../cattle/cattle.db') 3.3 import metadata .csv files # cows: old tag, new tag, breed cows = read.csv('../cattle/raw data/tag-breed-info.csv') %>% mutate(tag_no = ifelse(new_tag == '', old_tag, new_tag)) # metrics: date, new tag, weight, bcs metrics = read.csv('../cattle/raw data/collar_pedometer-metadata/collars.peds_all.csv') %>% rename(old_tag = tag_no) %>% mutate(tag_no = ifelse(new_tag == '', old_tag, new_tag)) %>% dplyr::select(date, tag_no, weight, BCS) # diet: collection date, new_tag, tube_id, process date diet = read.csv('../cattle/raw data/fecal sample ID.csv') %>% dplyr::select(Collection_Date, Tag, New_Tag, Tube, Processing_Date) %>% rename(old_tag = Tag, new_tag = New_Tag, collection_date = Collection_Date, processing_date = Processing_Date, tube = Tube) %>% filter(tube != '') # deployments: new_tag, collar_no, download_start, download_end deployments = read.csv('../cattle/raw data/collar_pedometer-metadata/collar data log.csv') %>% dplyr::select(tag.no, collar.no, download_start, download_end) %>% rename(tag_no = tag.no, collar_no = collar.no) # collars: collar_no, brand, status collars = read.csv('../cattle/raw data/collar_pedometer-metadata/collars.csv') %>% dplyr::select(Serial.No, status, brand) %>% rename(collar_no = Serial.No) # gps_raw: date, collar_no, temp, lat, long, DOP, satellites gps_raw = read.csv('../cattle/processed data/2021-2022_GPS-combined.csv') %>% rename(collar_no = CollarSerialNumber, date = date_time) 3.4 add tag_no column to diet data for(i in 1:nrow(diet)){ diet$tag_no[i] = ifelse(diet$new_tag[i] == '', cows[which(cows$old_tag == diet$old_tag[i]),]$tag_no, diet$new_tag[i]) } 3.5 create tables in SQL 3.5.1 cows # create table dbExecute(cattle_db, 'CREATE TABLE cows ( tag_no varchar(4) NOT NULL, old_tag varchar(4), new_tag varchar(4), breed varchar(6), PRIMARY KEY (tag_no));') # populate table dbWriteTable(cattle_db, 'cows', cows, append = T) dbGetQuery(cattle_db, 'SELECT * FROM cows LIMIT 10;') 3.5.2 metrics # create table dbExecute(cattle_db, 'CREATE TABLE metrics ( metric_id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT, tag_no varchar(4), weight double, BCS double, date text, FOREIGN KEY(tag_no) REFERENCES cows(tag_no));') # populate table metrics$metric_id = 1:nrow(metrics) metrics = metrics[, c('metric_id', 'tag_no', 'weight', 'BCS', 'date')] dbWriteTable(cattle_db, 'metrics', metrics, append = T) dbGetQuery(cattle_db, 'SELECT * FROM metrics LIMIT 10;') 3.5.3 diet # create table dbExecute(cattle_db, 'CREATE TABLE diet ( collection_date text, old_tag varchar(4), new_tag varchar(4), tube text, processing_date text, tag_no varchar(4), PRIMARY KEY (tube), FOREIGN KEY (tag_no) REFERENCES cows(tag_no));') # populate table dbWriteTable(cattle_db, 'diet', diet, append = T) dbGetQuery(cattle_db, 'SELECT * FROM diet LIMIT 10;') 3.5.4 collars # create table dbExecute(cattle_db, 'CREATE TABLE collars ( collar_no double, status text, brand text, PRIMARY KEY (collar_no));') # populate table dbWriteTable(cattle_db, 'collars', collars, append = T) dbGetQuery(cattle_db, 'SELECT * FROM collars LIMIT 10;') 3.5.5 deployments # create table dbExecute(cattle_db, 'CREATE TABLE deployments ( deployment_id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT, tag_no varchar(4), collar_no double, download_start text, download_end text, FOREIGN KEY(tag_no) REFERENCES cows(tag_no) FOREIGN KEY(collar_no) REFERENCES collars(collar_no));') # populate table deployments$deployment_id = 1:nrow(deployments) deployments = deployments[, c('deployment_id', 'tag_no', 'collar_no', 'download_start', 'download_end')] dbWriteTable(cattle_db, 'deployments', deployments, append = T) dbGetQuery(cattle_db, 'SELECT * FROM deployments LIMIT 10;') 3.5.6 gps_raw # create table dbExecute(cattle_db, 'CREATE TABLE gps_raw ( fix_id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT, collar_no integer, date text, Latitude double, Longitude double, Temperature double, NumSats integer, FOREIGN KEY(collar_no) REFERENCES collars(collar_no));') # populate table gps_raw$fix_id = 1:nrow(gps_raw) gps_raw = gps_raw[, c('fix_id', 'collar_no', 'date', 'Latitude', 'Longitude', 'Temperature', 'NumSats')] dbWriteTable(cattle_db, 'gps_raw', gps_raw, append = T) dbGetQuery(cattle_db, 'SELECT * FROM gps_raw LIMIT 10;') 3.5.7 link gps_raw to tag_no # create table dbExecute(cattle_db, 'CREATE TABLE gps ( loc_id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY, collar_no integer, tag_no varchar(4), date text, Latitude double, Longitude double, Temperature double, NumSats integer, FOREIGN KEY (collar_no) REFERENCES collars(collar_no) FOREIGN KEY (tag_no) REFERENCES cows(tag_no));') # insert data into gps table from gps_raw and deployments dbExecute(cattle_db, 'INSERT INTO gps ( collar_no, tag_no, date, Latitude, Longitude, Temperature, NumSats) SELECT deployments.collar_no, deployments.tag_no, gps_raw.date, gps_raw.Latitude, gps_raw.Longitude, gps_raw.Temperature, gps_raw.NumSats FROM deployments LEFT JOIN gps_raw USING (collar_no) WHERE gps_raw.collar_no = deployments.collar_no AND ( ( (strftime(gps_raw.date) >= strftime(deployments.download_start)) AND (strftime(gps_raw.date) <= strftime(deployments.download_end)) ) OR ( (strftime(gps_raw.date) >= strftime(deployments.download_start)) AND deployments.download_end IS NULL ) ) ') dbGetQuery(cattle_db, 'SELECT * FROM gps LIMIT 10;')
